doc.after: The black vulture is considered a threat by cattle ranchers due to its predation on newborn cattle.[49] The droppings produced by black vultures and other vultures can harm or kill trees and other vegetation.[50] The bird is also considered a threat to the safety of aerial traffic, especially when it congregates in large numbers in the vicinity of garbage dumps[51] â as is the case in the Rio de Janeiro Tom Jobim International Airport.[52]
